definition: eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

pinyin: Ye1 he2 hua2 Jian4 zheng4 ren2

sentences.english: The hands of the witnesses must be the first in putting him to death, and then the hands of all the people.
sentences.chinese: 見證人要先下手，然後衆民也下手將他治死。

sentences.english: Practice repeatedly proves that history is the most telling witness.
sentences.chinese: 實踐反覆證明歷史是最有力的見證人。

sentences.english: Morris Chang is living proof of Taiwan's ability to transform its economy.
sentences.chinese: 張忠謀是臺灣經濟轉型能力的見證人之一。

sentences.english: So I never became a Jehovah's Witness.
sentences.chinese: 因此我沒能成爲一名耶和華見證人。

sentences.english: Two witnesses must certify that this is your signature.
sentences.chinese: 須有兩個見證人證明這確是你的簽字。

sentences.english: The undermentioned is witness to this contract.
sentences.chinese: 以下爲本合同之見證人。

sentences.english: The Other witness or witnesses as well as the testator shall sign it, too.
sentences.chinese: 不僅遺囑人而且其它見證人也應簽名。

sentences.english: The witness is required to complete Part III of the form and sign thereunder .
sentences.chinese: 見證人必須填寫及簽署提名錶格第三部份。

sentences.english: The witness is required to complete and sign Part II of this notice.
sentences.chinese: 此通知第二部份須由見證人填寫及簽署。

sentences.english: If there is any witness present, the witness may be asked for affixing his signature or seal.
sentences.chinese: 有見證人在場的，可以請見證人簽名或者蓋章。

sentences.english: If there is any witness present, the witness may be asked for affixing his signature or seal.
sentences.chinese: 有見證人在場的，可以請見證人簽名或者蓋章。

sentences.english: He is a key witness in this case.
sentences.chinese: 在這個案件中，他是一個主要見證人。
見證人證實了警察的陳述。

sentences.english: We are both witness to and makers of significant change.
sentences.chinese: 我們是重大變革的見證人和創造者。

sentences.english: On that day Peter was looking for a witness to all this.
sentences.chinese: 那天，伯多祿就是在找出這一切的見證人。

sentences.english: Of course, the best referee won’t cave, no matter what.
sentences.chinese: 當然了，如論發生什麼事，最好的見證人絕不會心軟。

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
